location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the back cover with 60; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 3-56; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains cover letters and correspondence relating to the distribution and destruction of the daily intelligence summaries of the Middle East Intelligence Centre in Cairo. A copy of the summaries was sent from the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf at Bushire to the Political Agency at Kuwait for perusal, and then onwards to Bahrain and Muscat. Instructions were that it was then destroyed.The file contains no intelligence summaries. These were almost certainly destroyed at Muscat, as instructed.Folios 57-58 are internal office notes.
